org.nodes

Class LightDGraph<L>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.nodes.LightDGraph<L>
  • Type Parameters:
    L -
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    DGraph<L>, FastWalkable<L,DNode<L>>, Graph<L>

    public class LightDGraph<L>
extends java.lang.Object
implements DGraph<L>, FastWalkable<L,DNode<L>>
    A light-weight (ie. low memory) implementation of a directed graph. This graph uses non-persistent objects for nodes and links. This means that these objects become invalid if the graph is edited in such a way that its node indices change. If a node or link object belonging to this graph is accessed after such a change, an exception will be thrown
    Author:
    Peter

        public long state()
        Description copied from interface: DGraph
        The state of a graph indicates whether it has changed. If the value returned by this method has changed, then a modification has been made. If the value is the same, then with great likelihood, the graph has not been modified.

      • neighborsFast

        public java.util.List<DNode<L>> neighborsFast(Node<L> node)
        Description copied from interface: FastWalkable
        Returns a collection of neighbors of the given node. The collection either contains no duplicate entries, or contains a duplicate of each node for for each link into that node. The returned list should support fast random access.
